titleproper.value:
Guide to the Bragaw family papers
                    <num>ARC.219</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-11-28T11:02-0500</date>

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Bragaw family papers, ARC.219, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

The Bragaw family resided in Newtown in Queens County, N.Y. Family members featured in this collection are mainly Andrew Bragaw and John R. Bragaw (1833-1897). The Andrew Bragaw documented in the collection is believed to be the man of the same name who lived from 1755 to 1828, was married to Neeltje (Eleanor) Wiltsie, and was an active member, Deacon, and Elder at the Dutch Church in Newtown. Catherine (1800-1858), Elizabeth (1794-1871), and Susan Bragaw (1802-1863), daughters of Andrew, are also featured in the collection. John R. Bragaw, a farmer, was born in Flushing Bay, Newtown. In 1864 he married Mary B. Ryerson (1835-1890) of Brooklyn in Kings County, N.Y. at the Newtown Presbyterian Church. John and Mary had five children. The exact familial relation between Andrew and John R. Bragaw is not known.

This collection contains various materials spanning the period 1810 to 1884 and pertaining to Andrew and John R. Bragaw of Newtown, Queens County, as well as Andrew's daughters, Catherine, Elizabeth, and Susan Bragaw. Items pertaining to Andrew Bragaw include a rental agreement with Richard Lawrence, and a deed between Andrew and his wife "Nelly" and a John Bragaw. Andrew's daughters are represented by one land deed. Items pertaining to John R. Bragaw include a school certificate issued by the Newtown Public School; the certificate from Bragaw's marriage to Mary B. Ryerson of Brooklyn; a letter granting Bragaw the right to administer the estate of his deceased mother, Mary H. Bragaw; and a stock certificate issued by the Newtown Williamsburg Railroad Company.

subject.value: Decedents' estates |z New York (State) |z Queens County
